Package com.example.eventmaster

Class Event

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventmaster.Event
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Event extends Object implements Serializable
The Event class represents a single event on the app. It contains all of the information needed for a single event.

The class implements Serializable to allow event data to be passed between activities

See Also:

    Constructs a new Event object with all the details This constructor initializes the event with the given name, description, device ID, capacity for the event, capacity for the waitlist, the date the event closes, and whether it has geolocation enabled.

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event()
      Default constructor required for calls to DataSnapshot.getValue(Event.class)

    • Event

      public Event(String eventName, String eventDescription, String deviceID, int eventCapacity, int waitlistCapacity, Date eventFinalDate, boolean geolocation, String notificationType)
      Constructs a new Event object with all the details This constructor initializes the event with the given name, description, device ID, capacity for the event, capacity for the waitlist, the date the event closes, and whether it has geolocation enabled.
      Parameters:
      eventName - The name of the Event.
      eventDescription - The description of the Event.
      deviceID - Device ID of the user who made the Event.
      eventCapacity - The final capacity for the Event (the number that will be sampled)
      waitlistCapacity - The capacity of entrants allowed to join the waitlist.
      eventFinalDate - Final date the event closes.
      geolocation - The final capacity for the Event (the number that will be sampled)

    • setGeolocation

      public void setGeolocation(boolean geolocation)
      Sets the event geolocation
      Parameters:
      geolocation - a boolean that denotes whether the Event Organizer can see the geolocation of Entrants
